SafeSSU


The SafeSSU secure website holds all the safety-related information available at Sonoma State University, including guidance and resources on reporting, counseling services, and advocacy. 


















Quick Exit
Click or press ctrl+z
to leave page quickly.















Home






Goals of SafeSSU
Promote and prioritize the health, safety, and personal wellness of our campus community. 
Educate our campus community on safety practices that will help to prevent and prepare for future emergencies. 
Create safe and inclusive programming through which our community can ask questions, seek guidance, and access critical resources. 


How do I report a...


Where do I get...



























Sexual Misconduct or Sexual Assault
Sexual assault is never the survivior's fault. Learn how to report sexual misconduct and assault, and access other important resources and support services. 






Physical or Workplace Violence
Any acts of violence witnessed at SSU should be reported to the Sonoma State Police Department. Learn how to make a report of violence or seek support for yourself or a friend. 






Bias Incident
Foster a safe campus community by preventing and reporting misconduct. Report an incident of bias and find resources.









Confidential Support for Students
All current students are eligible for mental health and medical services on campus. Find support on-campus and other valuable resources.






Mental Health Counseling
Employees and students have access to free or low cost mental health resources. Learn about what resources are available. 






Protecting yourself online
Guidelines to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive information, critical systems, and other important information assets.  









Students  of Concern
Students who may need guidance or be struggling have resources through the Care Team. Access care now. 






Stalking
Stalking violates SSU policy and Student Code of Conduct. If you are being stalked, tell us.






Safety Reports and Policies
Safety resources, crime logs, crime bulletins, and other reports are readily available to the campus community. Read the safety publications here
